text: I have the exact same model. And I‚Äôm experiencing heating issues specially using the camera and mobile data. It gets hotter when you reach 70% down to 50%. Told the the Apple Center about this issue, 1st they told me to wait for the 18.1 update on the ios. At first I thought it was ok then as the days pass by the issue is still there. And it‚Äôs affecting battery life. Although I had my charging set to 90% and I usually charge when I get to 40%. Trying my best not to think about it and trying to be positive about it. Maybe they will have a fix on the issue on the next update with the 18.2 ios. If there‚Äôs no improvement then I will be coming back to the Apple Center. I love the phone and the only disappointment is the heating issue. If I‚Äôve known that I‚Äôm gonna experience this issue, coming from 12 Pro Max I should have gone for the 16 Pro. I think the 16 Pro models has a better cooling system as it‚Äôs a new layout inside while the base 16 models use the same system with all the 15 models. I just want to try the smaller and basic models. That‚Äôs why I chose the 16. The Apple Intelligence is not really bothering me maybe because I‚Äôm not a reviewer or vlogger or blogger what bother‚Äôs me the most is the heating issue and the battery life. As that‚Äôs the most basic important thing daily for the user. They already knew the issue and they still didn‚Äôt fix it. And they pride themselves that Apple has the better products. Yet Android phones are better at this area. It‚Äôs just disappointing. Without the heating issue, it would have been perfect for me.

I love the S24 ultra, I‚Äôm just an iPhone person when I use my iPhone 16 Plus for work, it doesn‚Äôt bother me at all. The S23+ doesn‚Äôt even compare to the 16 plus, not at all. The S24 U is actually behind on benchmarks now with the 16 plus, but the S24 ultra is still a beast. The base 17‚Äôs will have 120 Hz, so I guess this argument is just for this year and the previous ones. It‚Äôs about if you like android or iOS, and what you‚Äôre willing to spend.

text:
¬†@Ninnjette-¬† üòÜ Not only have I been in the Mobile business for a very long time and moved up the ladder, I have also worked with high level execs in the business. I no longer do now because of other ventures I took interest in but I can say for certain that you are full of it with the S24 Ultra and its scale of issues because I have seen the Macro level while you probably see a narrowed micro level. Let us not forget the plague of issues with the 16 that I can throw your way too. Benchmarks don't mean a whole lot when most flagships can run apps and software navigation like a champ. Maybe you'd have an argument 3 - 4 years ago but you don't now. I'm not saying iPhones suck but its a kids phone to me when Apple can't take care of their customers by aligning with technical standards now and before such as 'cough' lightning cable 'cough' 'cough' RCS 'cough' High Refresh displays 'cough'. Sorry still recovering from Covid. Years of being late to hardware standards but who cares right? It's Apple. They always get it right üòÜ
But let me make something clear. I can acknowledge that Apple has earned its place as a major market share holder. I just dont think they deserve number one as someone that likes to see continued growth in innovation and offering a return on investment through that innovation and spend over a thousand.

That was almost equivalent to saying a 10kg bag of feathers is heavier thqn a 10kg block of iron. text: I have the exact same model. And I‚Äôm experiencing heating issues specially using the camera and mobile data. It gets hotter when you reach 70% down to 50%. Told the the Apple Center about this issue, 1st they told me to wait for the 18.1 update on the ios. At first I thought it was ok then as the days pass by the issue is still there. And it‚Äôs affecting battery life. Although I had my charging set to 90% and I usually charge when I get to 40%. Trying my best not to think about it and trying to be positive about it. Maybe they will have a fix on the issue on the next update with the 18.2 ios. If there‚Äôs no improvement then I will be coming back to the Apple Center. I love the phone and the only disappointment is the heating issue. If I‚Äôve known that I‚Äôm gonna experience this issue, coming from 12 Pro Max I should have gone for the 16 Pro. I think the 16 Pro models has a better cooling system as it‚Äôs a new layout inside while the base 16 models use the same system with all the 15 models. I just want to try the smaller and basic models. That‚Äôs why I chose the 16. The Apple Intelligence is not really bothering me maybe because I‚Äôm not a reviewer or vlogger or blogger what bother‚Äôs me the most is the heating issue and the battery life. As that‚Äôs the most basic important thing daily for the user. They already knew the issue and they still didn‚Äôt fix it. And they pride themselves that Apple has the better products. Yet Android phones are better at this area. It‚Äôs just disappointing. Without the heating issue, it would have been perfect for me.

text:
quick tip on the capture button (especially if you are accidentally pressing it): If you go to the settings you you can change it to double click to open. This is beneficial for two reasons:

- prevents accidental clicks
- makes it so that if you're phone is dormant (either screen is off or in always on mode) you dont have to wake your phone to trigger the camera

text: I don‚Äôt think you‚Äôre getting the best value for your money by buying an Android phone that costs the same as the iPhone 16. It‚Äôs important to consider how long you‚Äôll be using the phone, and the iPhone 16 will likely last much longer than any of the Android devices you showed. So, no, you‚Äôre not getting a good deal.
